avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate southerly wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in high Alpine regions. Dry and moist avalanches can be released in near-surface layers and reach quite a large size, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes.
In particular low altitudes: As the moisture increases moist and wet snow slides are possible, even medium-sized ones. In particular on very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind and new snow above the tree line: Dry avalanches at elevated altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2400 m. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and southerly wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in high Alpine regions. Dry and moist avalanches can be released in near-surface layers and reach medium size, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes.
In particular low altitudes: As the moisture increases more moist and wet snow slides are possible, but they will be mostly small. In particular on very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind and new snow above the tree line: Dry avalanches at elevated altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 15 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2400 m. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow.

avalancheActivity.comment: The new snow and wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant at high altitude, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes. As a consequence of new snow and wind avalanches are possible towards the evening, even large ones in isolated cases. Slight decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the snowfall level drops. The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent in the afternoon.

snowpackStructure.comment: 15 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until the evening. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow.

avalancheActivity.comment: The new snow and wind slabs can be released easily at high altitude, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released also by a single winter sport participant. In particular low altitudes: As the moisture increases more moist and wet snow slides are possible, but they will be mostly small.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind, wind slabs formed at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment: 15 to 20 cm of snow has fallen above approximately 2400 m. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line.
